title: Sam Altman: Ousted OpenAI boss to return days after being sacked
relevance_explanation: This document is highly relevant as it details the firing and subsequent rehiring of Sam Altman from OpenAI, the internal disputes within the company, and the involvement of external entities like Microsoft. It touches on the power dynamics, internal company culture, and the strategic or emotional motivations behind key decisions, which are crucial to understanding the overall situation.
summary: Sam Altman was fired as OpenAI boss by the board but is set to return following staff backlash and new board appointments. Co-founder Greg Brockman resigned in protest of Altman's firing but will also return. Microsoft offered Altman a position which was potentially a factor in the board's revision of their decision. OpenAI is undergoing a reconstitution including the addition of Bret Taylor and Larry Summers to its board, indicating a shift in internal dynamics.
